user_review: Cru oyster bar is located in St-Lambert, and has some awesome dishes to offer! We tried three different kinds of oyster: Kumamoto, Lucky Lime and BlackBerry point. The beef tartare is served on bone marrow, which can be scooped up and serve with the tartare to make it richer and juicier! Lobster cavatelli and black cod are both delicious. And the dessert just knocks it out of the park! The fried banana bread with walnut is soft and chewy, but not too sweet. Just the right amount of flavor and texture.

I literally love this place. I spent my summer in St Lambert and ate here many times. Love the off menu scallop . The staff and atmosphere are amazing and entire menu is well crafted. Anytime I'm in St Lambert going forward, you will find me here!

I had a wonderful night dinning at Cru. The staff was very friendly and very professional. We were 4 then suddenly we saw 2 other friends so we decide to eat together. We asking to move to a bigger table and the waiter just carry everything for us even it was busy that night! I know that some restaurants does not do that for their customers.The food was amazing, the beef tartare and the wagyu burger was so delicious that i would definitely go back ! Definitely recommend to families and friends!!!

Only popped in to take a look as this place is fairly new to st lambert. Five months the friendly professional host said. The place is lovely! Modern and clean yet cosy. Fresh oysters and seafood and a few aged to perfection meats. Two bars. One of them for meats. Great outdoor patio. Can't wait to come back and linger over a menu and some good wine.

A beautiful restaurant with wonderful service, Cru has tables for large parties as well as small intimate spaces for couples enjoying a night out.  The staff is friendly and allows diners to enjoy as long as they like.  We tried the dozen oysters (3 different kinds) and they are some of the best I've ever had . . . fresh, vibrant with great mignonette sauce.  In addition, we had the Kale salad, rib eye, and fish special of the day.  Completely satisfied with everything.

Ok this place is pricey but when you factor in that you don't have to drive over the crumbling bridge for good seafood, then it makes it worth it!The fish of the day was yummy and the mac and cheese too(a bit salty though)

Beautiful restaurant which serves incredible food whilst served with amazing staff! From beginning to end one of the most wonderful culinary experiences in quite awhile!! Thank you to the owner and his staff for providing delicious food with outmost class!!
